metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13103 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible
metadata.Description:
A crafted self-referential DOS partition table will cause all Das U-Bootversions through 2019.07-rc4 to infinitely recurse, causing the stack togrow infinitely and eventually either crash or overwrite other data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13103` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

u-boot - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-amlogic - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-exynos - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-imx - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-mvebu - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-omap - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-qcom - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-qemu - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-rockchip - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-rpi - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-sifive - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-sunxi - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-tegra - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-tools - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: u-boot package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
